page.title: 11RAILWAY
page.content: The first railway station was situated off railway street in 1848 and was part of the Maldon,Witham and Braintree railway in 1869 there opened the Bishops Stortford and Dunmow part of the line.A new and existing railway station was built south of the old one.Fortunes and use of the railway have varied over the years.Now the line runs from Braintree to Witham with some through trains to Liverpool Street. The station buildings have remained largely unchanged but only one platform is in use.The old track bed towards Rayne prouides an attractive walk and haven for wild life.
